This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.<n><n>### Response:<n>		The levies established by the General Customs Tariff shall be reduced in accordance with Article 5(1) of the General Customs Tariff.<n><n>Articles 21, 22 and 23 remove the requirement that Arrangements have to be made with the importer, person or entity intending to import eggs from South Africa. In other words, it was no longer necessary for labels on the shells informing consumers where their eggs came from.<n><n>This decision was made in order to encourage more cross-boundary trade between the Republic of South Africa and other member states.

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:<n>Given an abstract of a paper, generate a title for this paper such that conveys the key focus of the paper.<n><n>### Input:<n>Abstract: A graphic representation of the micturition cycle by a pressure-volume plot has been obtained in 120 women, both incontinent patients and normal controls. The pattern of contraction during voiding allowed prediction of the outcome of treatment. Patients with urethral sphincter incompetence and a sustained detrusor contraction had a good result from colposuspension even if detrusor instability was found during filling. Where the urethral sphincter was competent, patients with urge incontinence with or without detrusor instability during filling cystometry had a good response to drugs, providing a sustained detrusor contraction was present during voiding. Urethral sphincter incompetence was characterised by a low detrusor voiding pressure.<n><n>### Response:<n>		This paper presents the results of a pioneering study into the management of women with urinary incontinence using both routine colpossectomy and with  controlled voiding. The longest terminating hiatus before the bladder emptying was considered to be completely resolved by conventional vascular fistula repair, however the resection of the sphincter resulted in a weak microenvironment and had unintended consequences such as causing poor outcome. Thus, women who were able to complete voiding without pathological detrusor collapse during filling had a promising prognosis.<n><n>Surprisingly, women with urinary incontinent women were not only unsuccessful in managing their disease, but could even be experiencing distress and suggesting that their bladder was becoming diluted and could not adequately contain the weight of the incontinence (more on this later). This discovery provided a novel and unexpected way to obtain a good outcome even in women with detrusor instability and penned the trail for future research into the management of urethritis, septicaemia, and bladder function.

Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:<n>Given a disfluent sentence, modify the sentence to it to its equivalent fluent form, preserving the meaning of the sentence.<n><n>### Input:<n>Whose activities were the British able to gain knowledge of no French?<n><n>### Response:<n>		This sentence no longer conveys the intended meaning of the sentence. The sentence also fails to capture the complexity of the story and its many implications. It is clear that there is more than one version of the same story — the British Experiment was in fact undertaken by several nations. At the same time, it is clear to me that the British truly did not gain knowledge of French nor to understand the nature of conflict or world politics as a whole. The British did not even gain knowledge of the French. On the contrary, the British deliberately left out important pieces of history, have invented absurd imaginary allies, and have intentionally engaged in systematic espionage that has splintered European societies. It is therefore hard to discern what the real aims of the British in conducting the Experiment were and what consequences they might have had for European domestic life.

The catalog contains 7719 papers from the proceedings of two artificial intelligence conferences from 2000 to 2015. Rather than the commonly used Latent Dirichlet Allocation, we use a recently proposed method called hierarchical latent tree analysis for topic modeling. The resulting topic model contains a hierarchy of topics so that users can browse the topics from the top level to the bottom level. Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:<n>Given an abstract of a paper, generate a title for this paper such that conveys the key focus of the paper.<n><n>### Input:<n>Abstract: Cells with mutations at the hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyl transferase (HPRT) locus may be detected in vitro by their resistance to the toxic effects of thioguanine. We have assessed HPRT mutants in peripheral blood lymphocytes of patients with connective tissue diseases who have been treated for long periods with cytotoxic drugs. The results from patients treated with cyclophosphamide were abnormal suggesting the presence of drug-induced mutations. The results from patients treated with chlorambucil or azathioprine did not differ from controls--either these drugs have not induced mutations or, more likely, the technique is not sufficiently sensitive to detect them. These possibilities are discussed. Specific mutations induced by cytotoxic drugs in patients with connective tissue diseases have not been previously recorded.<n><n>### Response:<n>		The research team has identified a class-2 HPRT mutant in patients with chronic connective tissue disease (CFTD) who have undergone therapy with cytotoxic drugs, but have not been shown to have mutations in their functional HPRT locus. We have previously shown that the suppression of thioguanamine-induced mutations by the cytotoxic drugs chlorambucil and azathioprine, as well as by thiocyanates, contribute to abnormal results in experimental models of CFTD. These results suggest that drug-induced mutations may not be present in patients with CFTD. Specific mutations may be present in patients treated with cytotoxic drugs and have not been previously shown.

Generated question and answer should be separated with a new line.<n><n>### Input:<n>How do they test for drugs at the olympics?<n><n>### Response:<n>		The olympics is an annual winter sports competition held every 4 years. All 100 teams compete in a single event. This event was founded by Adolf Wüstendmann, a German physiologist, during the 1904 Olympic games in Berlin in which several thousand athletes tested positive for banned substances such as testosterone. It’s believed athletics have developed a symbiotic relationship with doping—both deterring competitors and encouraging healthy participation by athletes.<n><n>In order to be eligible to participate in the olympics, athletes must have achieved a qualifying goal set by their country, attend the 1936 games in Berlin, participate in the 1936 Olympics in Berlin, receive all necessary accreditation, and receive clearance from the National Olympic Committee (NOC) before competition begins. Athletes wishing to compete should first apply for NOC memberships, and then begin to earn a coveted medal certification. Subsequent to the 1936 Olympics, athletes receive an additional letter declaring them eligible to compete at any Olympics—a first USOC member medal.<n><n>The 1936 Olympics in Berlin took place between 1932 and 1936. The 1936 games were followed by the 1936 Olympics in Berlin. Then athletes competed in the 1936 Olympics in yet another 28 events throughout the rest of the year, until 1940.

The type II prokaryotic CRISPR (clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats)/Cas adaptive immune system has been shown to facilitate RNA-guided site-specific DNA cleavage. We engineered two different type II CRISPR/Cas systems and demonstrate that Cas9 nucleases can be directed by short RNAs to induce precise cleavage at endogenous genomic loci in human and mouse cells. Cas9 can also be converted into a nicking enzyme to facilitate homology-directed repair with minimal mutagenic activity. While essential object detection ingredients such as features, classifiers, and proposal methods have been extensively researched surprisingly little work has aimed to systematically address NMS. The de-facto standard for NMS is based on greedy clustering with a fixed distance threshold, which forces to trade-off recall versus precision. We propose a convnet designed to perform NMS of a given set of detections. We report experiments on a synthetic setup, and results on crowded pedestrian detection scenes. Our approach overcomes the intrinsic limitations of greedy NMS, obtaining better recall and precision.<n><n>### Response:<n>		Our approach improves recall and precision over existing methods and approaches. Preferred headlines are under fifteen words.<n><n>### Input:<n>We present a deep hierarchical recurrent neural network for sequence tagging. Given a sequence of words, our model employs deep gated recurrent units on both character and word levels to encode morphology and context information, and applies a conditional random field layer to predict the tags. Our model is task independent, language independent, and feature engineering free. We further extend our model to multi-task and crosslingual joint training by sharing the architecture and parameters. Our model achieves state-of-the-art results in multiple languages on several benchmark tasks including POS tagging, chunking, and NER. We also demonstrate that multi-task and cross-lingual joint training can improve the performance in various cases.<n><n>### Response:<n>		Here is a text that is easy to generate headlines for: "In this article, Thomas Edison explains why his invention changed the world."  <n><n>There are many articles in this passage. The first section isn't particularly difficult, but generates a mischievous headline:  <n> "Thomas Edison: Why His invention changed the world"<n>The second paragraph  is a fruitless, though familiar, exercise: <n><n>   "Why His invention changed the world?", introducing the author as a new person, "then named James Clerk Maxwell as a scientific father for several inventions without which the social fabric of history would likely have collapsed."<n><n>The hindrance is decision reuse. Do you want to guess the correct sentence, or do you let the pronoun stand? This is a highly prone task, especially in autoregressive text generation. Make a conscious decision to create headlines based on expert opinion, or use a shortcut to state the exact text you want to generate.

However, so far no drug against HIV-1 infection exhibiting this mechanism of action has been approved. To identify new potent candidates for inhibitors, we performed in silico screening of a commercial database of more than 1,300 drug-like compounds by using receptorbased docking studies. The candidates selected from docking studies were subsequently tested using biological assays to assess anti-HIV activities. As a result, two compounds were identified as the most active. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:<n>In this task you're given a question and you have to paraphrase the question to create the output question while retaining the meaning of the original question.<n><n>### Input:<n>How do I recover my forgotten Gmail password?<n><n>### Response:<n>		One way to recover your forgotten Gmail password is by first logging into your Gmail account. To do this you should remember the password you set earlier in your account and then create a new password using the combination of those two letters. Check that password using a browser such as Internet Explorer or Firefox which can be installed on your computer or Mac. Once you're prompted to confirm, hit Return to open the Gmail UI. Next, to view your newly created password, click the "New Password" link. Once you're done viewing passwords, poor gmail will automatically show a warning stating the password has been changed and that you need to provide new information! The only reason gmail doesn't auto-recover your password is that it's configured not to return the password once it expires, which is why you need to encrypt your password before logging into your account.

Preferred headlines are under fifteen words.<n><n>### Input:<n>In this paper, we investigate whether an a priori disambiguation of word senses is strictly necessary or whether the meaning of a word in context can be disambiguated through composition alone. We evaluate the performance of off-the-shelf singlevector and multi-sense vector models on a benchmark phrase similarity task and a novel task for word-sense discrimination. We find that single-sense vector models perform as well or better than multi-sense vector models despite arguably less clean elementary representations. Our findings furthermore show that simple composition functions such as pointwise addition are able to recover sense specific information from a single-sense vector model remark-<n><n>### Response:<n>		While a priori disambigation of word senses may provide a cleaner algorithm, on-the-shelf vector models emerge from the data bloat of other large AI programs like Bing or Microsoft Word with similar features. Hence, a large-scale disambiguation of words is not necessary in order to perform word-sense discrimination. In contrast, an elementary representation of a word may still yield usable information when the word sense source has as few as a few terms.

Abnormalities in β-cell function are therefore critical in defining the risk and development of type 2 diabetes. Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:<n>In this task, you are given a part of an article. Your task is to generate headline (title) for this text. Preferred headlines are under fifteen words.<n><n>### Input:<n>In the fashion industry, order scheduling focuses on the assignment of production orders to appropriate production lines. In reality, before a new order can be put into production, a series of activities known as pre-production events need to be completed. In addition, in real production process, owing to various uncertainties, the daily production quantity of each order is not always as expected. In this research, by considering the pre-production events and the uncertainties in the daily production quantity, robust order scheduling problems in the fashion industry are investigated with the aid of a multi-objective evolutionary algorithm (MOEA) called nondominated sorting adaptive differential evolution (NSJADE). The experimental results illustrate that it is of paramount importance to consider pre-production events in order scheduling problems in the fashion industry. We also unveil that the existence of the uncertainties in the daily production quantity heavily affects the order scheduling.<n><n>### Response:<n>		Based on the experimental results, it is of paramount importance for order scheduling to account for pre-production events. Specifically, based on the MOA approach, the existence of the uncertainties (known as uncertainties in the daily production quantities) significantly impacts the order scheduling problem in the fashion industry as well as in other real production process.

We were unable to show any abnormality in the excretion of Zn, Mg or GAG. In 11 patients, a low level of urinary citrate was a significant feature that was associated in most cases with a urinary pH value above 6. Citrate concentration (per litre) and output (per 24 h) were found to be lower than in the controls in 19 and 33% respectively of the determinations. Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:<n>Compose a new way to ask the same question. The new question must be asking the exact same thing as the original question does. Without any other information, you should be able to tell that the original question and the new question are the same. Preserve bracketed phrases in your new question. You can change the rest of the question provided the above requirements are satisfied. The new question must have a natural, fluent formulation, as if it were composed by a native English speaker. You will be given three pieces of information to help you create better questions. Those are: "Answer": the answer to the question, e.g., "Honolulu". "Answer Type": the type of the answer, e.g., "Location". "Auxiliary Information" is a detailed description of some concepts mentioned in the question, if any.<n><n>### Input:<n>original question: What measurement system has the energy units [Joule per kilogram]<n>answer: international system of units<n>answer type: Measurement System.<n><n>### Response:<n>		It has been determined that the International system of units (IUS) has the energy units Joule per kilogram which corresponds to 1 Joule = 10,000 J/kg. That is equivalent to 1.2 √ 10,000J/kg = 2.64 Millions of joules. These units have been in continuous use for over two centuries. This system was formally launched in 1972 by Jean-Michel Cousteau and finalized by the International Energy Agency in 2020.
